author: Staff Reporter
text:
Rejecting a plea to restrain the State government from conducting the exam for selection of 47 entry-level posts in the Tamil Nadu Wakf Board scheduled for Saturday, the Madras High Court ordered status quo in respect of the employment of the petitioner, who apprehended termination from service in view of the recruitment drive.

The petitioner, I. Jainulabudeen was appointed as junior assistant in December 2007 on a temporary basis. According to him, the board used to terminate employees recruited on temporary basis on completion of 89 days of service and re-appoint them the very next day to avoid regularising their service.

In view of an advertisement issued by the board in July 2015 inviting applications for 47 posts, the petitioner, who is working as Wakf Inspector, apprehended that the board would terminate his services.

However, it orders status quo in respect of employment of petitioner
title: High Court refuses to stay recruitment to Wakf Board
